result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin W Markin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Austin W Markin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Austin W Markin was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $692  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL, IID and approval of agent. Not use/possess alcohol.
DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber.  Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply. Credit does NOT apply.

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 5/27/22 sent electronically to DCJ

**THE COURT VACATES THE 5/25 IA**
Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.

**THE COURT VACATES THE 5/25/22 PLEA AND SENTENCE AND RESENTENCES DEF**
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Sasa Johnen.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2   . 
  Victim rights compliance.

COUNT #    1
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, cc to 21CT224, 21CT358, 21CF2005 

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 120 days in DCJ, w/Huber and good time, to commence f/w 

-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Do not drive a MV w/o valid DL, agent approval, and IID
-Not use/possess alcohol
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
$600 Fine + cc
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. Fine + V/W surcharge due on probation

-Revocation of drivers license for 36 months cc
-Ignition Interlock Device required upon licensure for 36 months cc
-AODA assessment

CREDIT:
-Days credit if revoked: 3

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC

**THE COURT VACATES THE 5/25 ARGN**
Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
